citation.article-title: Adlercreutzia equolifaciens gen. nov., sp. nov., an equol-producing bacterium isolated from human faeces, and emended description of the genus Eggerthella.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Adlercreutzia equolifaciens sp. nov.
Adlercreutzia equolifaciens (e.quo.li.fa′ci.ens. N.L. n. equol -olis equol; L. part. adj. faciens making; N.L. part. adj. equolifaciens equol-producing).
Displays the following properties in addition to those given in the genus description.
The principal respiratory quinone is DMMK-6 (70–96 %); MMK-6 (1–29 %) is a minor component.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 64 mol%.
The type strain is strain FJC-B9T (=JCM 14793T =DSM 19450T =CCUG 54925T), which was isolated from faeces of a healthy human.
